2025-02-01.title: Broken Access Control
2025-02-01.description: Improper access control can expose sensitive information and unauthorized resources.
2025-02-01.impact: Can lead to data breaches, privilege escalation, and unauthorized access.
2025-02-01.solution: Implement role-based access control and verify permissions systematically.

2025-02-02.title: Security Misconfiguration
2025-02-02.description: Default configurations can expose your application to attacks.
2025-02-02.impact: Can lead to data leaks, exploitation of vulnerabilities, and system compromise.
2025-02-02.solution: Regularly update configurations and remove unused services or features.

2025-02-03.title: Sensitive Data Exposure
2025-02-03.description: Sensitive data is not properly protected, making it vulnerable to theft.
2025-02-03.impact: Can lead to identity theft, fraud, and compliance violations.
2025-02-03.solution: Use encryption, enforce HTTPS, and secure data in transit and at rest.

2025-02-04.title: Broken Authentication
2025-02-04.description: Weak authentication mechanisms can allow unauthorized access.
2025-02-04.impact: Can lead to account takeovers and unauthorized system access.
2025-02-04.solution: Implement strong password policies, use MFA, and prevent brute force attacks.

2025-02-05.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
2025-02-05.description: XSS attacks inject malicious scripts into web applications.
2025-02-05.impact: Can lead to session hijacking, defacement, and phishing attacks.
2025-02-05.solution: Sanitize and validate user input, use Content Security Policy (CSP).

2025-02-06.title: SQL Injection
2025-02-06.description: SQL Injection is a code injection technique that can destroy your database.
2025-02-06.impact: Can lead to data breaches, unauthorized access, and database corruption.
2025-02-06.solution: Use parameterized queries and prepared statements to prevent injection.

2025-02-07.title: Insecure Design
2025-02-07.description: Flaws in application design lead to exploitable vulnerabilities.
2025-02-07.impact: Can result in data leaks, improper functionality, and insecure integrations.
2025-02-07.solution: Follow secure design principles and perform threat modeling during development.

2025-02-08.title: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
2025-02-08.description: SSRF allows attackers to send requests from a server to unintended destinations.
2025-02-08.impact: Can lead to unauthorized data access and compromise of internal systems.
2025-02-08.solution: Validate and sanitize user inputs, and restrict outbound requests.
